extendedIngredients.name: banana leaves
extendedIngredients.original: 4 large banana leaves (or unbleached parchment paper)

extendedIngredients.name: fresh gingerroot
extendedIngredients.original: 1 inch cube fresh gingerroot, finely chopped (or grated)

extendedIngredients.name: garlic cloves
extendedIngredients.original: 2 garlic cloves , peeled and finely chopped (or grated)
extendedIngredients.originalName: garlic cloves , peeled and finely chopped (or grated)

extendedIngredients.name: green onions
extendedIngredients.original: 2 green onions , finely chopped (green part only)
extendedIngredients.originalName: green onions , finely chopped (green part only)

extendedIngredients.name: tilapia fillets
extendedIngredients.original: 4 (4 oz) fresh tilapia fillets (or other firm-fleshed whitefish)
extendedIngredients.originalName: fresh tilapia fillets (or other firm-fleshed whitefish)

title: Baked Wrapped Tilapia
summary: Baked Wrapped Tilapian is a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe with 4 servings. This main course has 203 calories, 23g of protein, and 9g of fat per serving. For $2.93 per serving, this recipe covers 15% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. If you have gingerroot, chili pepper, sesame oil, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the maple syrup you could follow this main course with the Vanilla-Almond Chia Breakfast Pudding as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 79%. This score is good. Similar recipes are Baked Wrapped Tilapia, Prosciutto-wrapped Tilapia, and Baked Tilapia.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Tilapia. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Thrive Pinot Grigio with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

instructions: Preheat oven to 400FCombine all topping ingredients in a bowl.Season with salt and pepper to taste.Place a fillet on each banana leaf and divide topping evenly among them, spreading it over the top.Fold each banana leaf over to form a packet around each fillet and seal the edge of each packet with a small piece of aluminum foil, crimping it tightly. Place on a baking sheet and bake 25 to 30 minutes.

steps.step: Combine all topping ingredients in a bowl.Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Place a fillet on each banana leaf and divide topping evenly among them, spreading it over the top.Fold each banana leaf over to form a packet around each fillet and seal the edge of each packet with a small piece of aluminum foil, crimping it tightly.
Place on a baking sheet and bake 25 to 30 minutes.
